thread.title: Vote due on the future of Guernsey's milk industry
thread.title_full: Vote due on the future of Guernsey's milk industry | Channel - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Vote due on the future of Guernsey's milk industry
text:
Guernsey States politicians are debating the future of the milking industry today.
They are deciding if milkmen and women should continue to have exclusive rights to sell milk to homes and shops , or if they should lose some of those rights.
It's possible that, if some of those selling rights are removed, the States would have to find a way to compensate them.
It follows years of dispute between the Commerce and Employment Department, which is in charge of the Guernsey Dairy, and the Guernsey Milk Retailers Association.
A vote is expected later today.
Last updated Fri 2 Oct 2015 Politics Guernsey
